other_tests.findings: Hypercellular, with 95 percent myeloperoxidase-positive blast cells. Confirmed the diagnosis of AML without maturation (FAB subtype M1).

Hypercellular, with 30 percent myeloperoxidase-positive blast cells containing Auer rods and aberrantly expressed CD7. Increased numbers of eosinophil precursors. Diagnosed as AML, subtype M2 with eosinophilia (M2Eo).
Normocellular but contained 35 percent myeloperoxidase-positive blast cells with Auer rods and aberrantly expressed CD7. Increased eosinophil precursors indicating AML, subtype M2Eo.
212delC mutation in CEBPA gene identified in patients III-1 and III-5. Identical mutation found in germ-line DNA from buccal-swab specimens.
A second mutation in CEBPA was identified in Patient III-1 at the time of diagnosis. This mutation was not detectable during remission and absent in germ-line DNA.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Resolved without medical intervention; normal blood counts over more than 20 months since diagnosis in both Patients III-1 and III-5.
